record.id: field.name=NULL and file.name=NULL and term="User utilities menu" and format.name=NULL and syslanguage="en"

brief.brief: This is the main menu for all user utilities.
From this menu, you may access the various user utilities. The menu only displays utilities allowed by your individual capabilities.

detail.detail: F1 - Receive Mail: Enables you to read mail. The command to run this option is "rmail".
F2 - Send Mail: Enables you to send mail to other users. The command to run this option is "smail".
F3 - MAIN MENU: Returns you to the main menu. The command to run this option is "main".
F4 - Database Dictionary: Calls the Database Dictionary utility. The command to run this option is "dbdict".
F5 - Display System Status: Enables you to see the status of all users (including background schedulers) in Service Manager. The command to run this option is "status".
F6 - View/Sched Spooled Rpts: Enables you to view or schedule reports in the spool table.
F7 - Maintain Schedule Queue: Enables you to see the scheduled background jobs using Database Manager. The command to run this option is "schedule".
F8 - Help Maintenance: Enables you to maintain online help records using Database Manager. The command to run this option is "help".
F9 - Format Contrl Maint.: Enables you to maintain Format Control records. The command to run this option is "fc".
F10 - Set Operator Password: Enables you to add or change user's password. This does not affect any external passwords. The command to run this option is "password".

F11 - Sched Backgrnd Mail Check: Enables you to schedule a background mail check. This check notifies all users with active server connections if they have mail every 10 minutes, or whatever interval you set. The command to run this option is "schmail".
F12 - More User Utilities: Sends you to the second user utilities menu. The command to run this option is "moreutil".
